value: A short, selection-based mystery game demo.
This is a short demo of the commands available in the TaleSpinner language.  It is a work in progress.
Welcome to the Demo Adventure, where we test out many of TaleSpinner's features.  This is a short, selection-based mystery game demo.  It is a work in progress.

on the far wall, and a
There is a picture window on the wall to your left, letting in a soft light that illuminates the room.  On the wall to your right, there is a sturdy

is over there sitting in the corner of the room, reading a book.

link that will rerender the location
You see a large fireplace.  It is currently unlit.
You see a comfortable-looking chair.  It beckons you.
A sturdy wooden door, fixed firmly into the wall.
It is currently unlocked and open.
The door is locked.  I need a key.
You unlock the door with the rusty key.
I need a key to unlock this door.
You are in the foyer.  It is a small room with a high ceiling and a large chandelier.  There is a large staircase leading up to the second floor.  There is an
leading to the study, and a long corridor leading to the back of the house.
You hear a clinking sound, like metal on metal.  It seems to be coming from the direction of the staircase.
It's getting louder.  It sounds like something is being dragged up the stairs.
You see a shadow at the top of the stairs.  It looks like someone is dragging something heavy up the stairs.
The shadow disappears, and the clinking sound stops.

You are in an unused study.  It is a small room with a high ceiling and a large desk.  There is a large window on the wall to your left, letting in a soft light that illuminates the room.  On the wall to your right, there is a
There's a shimmering mirror standing in the corner that you might be able to
You have entered the Study for the very first time!
This is your second time in the Study.
This is your third time in the Study. No more updates after this.
As you exit, the monacle glows briefly, and you feel a strange sensation.
You are in a mysterious room.  It is a small room with a high ceiling and a large desk.  There is a large window on the wall to your left, letting in a soft light that illuminates the room.
inside.  It is addressed to you.  What could it say?
P.S. Q says get on with it!
James: We must get the plans back by tonight! We believe they're hidden within this Fun House. Signed, M.
P.S. Q says enjoy the gum!
It is a rusty key, probably for an old lock.  It looks like it has been here for a long time.
It is a monacle, a single eyeglass.  It is made of brass and has a leather strap.
lies in the corner, discarded.  Next to a
It is a large umbrella, made of black fabric.  It has a wooden handle and a brass tip.  It is currently open, as if it had been used recently.
is sitting in the corner of the room, reading a book.

You see a venerable sage sitting in the corner of the room, reading a book.  He is an old man with a long white beard and wise, thoughtful eyes.  His presence adds an air of mystery and knowledge to the library.
The sage looks up from his book and nods at you. "Greetings, traveler. How may I assist you on your journey?"
The sage looks up from his book and smiles. "Ah, a fellow seeker of knowledge! Books are the keys to understanding the world around us."
The sage looks up from his book and nods. "That door leads to the study. It's a quiet place, perfect for reading or contemplation."
